Contract-Read.description:
A Service Contract, also known as a Service Agreement, is a legally binding document between a service provider and a customer (organization).
It establishes the terms and conditions governing the provision of services. In the context of ticketing, a Service Contract may be used to define the terms of their service, such as ticket distribution, payment processing, customer support, etc.
It typically includes provisions related to pricing, responsibilities, termination clauses, and liability.

billing.description: A dictionary containing information about the contract's billing, including the start date, initial cost, and adjusted cost.

duration.description: Duration of the contract in ISO 8601 duration format.

effectiveDate.description: The date and time the contract becomes effective, in ISO 8601 format. The effective date must not be earlier than the billing start date.

number.description: Number assigned to the contract by the organization. Each contract must have a unique contract number to ensure that contracts can be easily identified and tracked.

onCall.description: The onCall property represents whether a staff member is currently available for on-call duties.

terminationDate.description: The date and time the contract is terminated, in ISO 8601 format. The termination date must be in the future and must not be earlier than the effective date.

type.description: The type of the contract defined by the organization.

createdAt.description: The date and time when the resource was created, in UTC format.

updatedAt.description: The date and time when the resource was updated, in UTC format.

It typically includes provisions related to pricing, responsibilities, termination clauses, and liability.

brand.description: The brand of the asset. The brand refers to the specific manufacturer or company that produces or sells an asset.

commissioningDate.description: The date when an asset is officially put into service or operation.

lifetime.description: The expected or estimated duration of an asset's useful life or operational lifespan.

model.description: The model of the asset. The model provides detailed information about the features, capabilities, and technical specifications of the asset.

mpn.description: The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) is a unique identifier assigned by the manufacturer to a specific part or component of an asset.

retirementDate.description: The date when an asset is expected to reach the end of its operational life based on the commissioning date and the estimated lifetime.

serialNumber.description: The unique identifier assigned to an individual asset, allowing for easy identification and tracking.
